verses.verse: Now the Lord <WH3068> had said <WH559> to Abram <WH87>, Get out <WH3212> of your country <WH776>, and from your relatives <WH4138>, and from your father <WH1>'s house <WH1004>, to a land <WH776> that I will show you <WH7200>:
And I will make of you <WH6213> a great <WH1419> nation <WH1471>, and I will bless <WH1288> you <WH1431>, and make your name <WH8034> great <WH1431>; and you shall be a blessing <WH1293>:
And I will bless <WH1288> them that bless <WH1288> you <WH779>, and curse him that curses <WH7043> you <WH4940>: and in you shall all families of the earth <WH127> be blessed <WH1288>.

So Abram <WH87> departed <WH3212>, as the Lord <WH3068> had spoken <WH1696> to him <WH3876>; and Lot went <WH3212> with him <WH87>: and Abram was seventy <WH7657> and five <WH2568> years <WH8141> old <WH1121> when he departed <WH3318> out of Haran <WH2771>.

And Abram <WH87> took <WH3947> Sarai <WH8297> his wife <WH802>, and Lot <WH3876> his brother <WH251>'s son <WH1121>, and all their substance <WH7399> that they had gathered <WH7408>, and the souls <WH5315> that they had gotten <WH6213> in Haran <WH2771>; and they went forth <WH3318> to go <WH3212> into the land <WH776> of Canaan <WH3667>; and into the land <WH776> of Canaan <WH3667> they came <WH935>.

And Abram <WH87> passed through <WH5674> the land <WH776> to the place <WH4725> of Sichem <WH7927>, to the oak <WH436> of Moreh <WH4176>. And the Canaanite <WH3669> was then <WH227> in the land <WH776>.

And the Lord <WH3068> appeared <WH7200> to Abram <WH87>, and said <WH559>, To your seed <WH2233> will I give <WH5414> this <WH2063> land <WH776>: and there built <WH1129> he an altar <WH4196> to the Lord <WH3068>, who appeared to him <WH7200>.

And he removed <WH6275> from there to a mountain <WH2022> on the east <WH6924> of Beth <WH1008>–el, and pitched <WH5186> his tent <WH168>, having Beth <WH1008>–el on the west <WH3220>, and Hai <WH5857> on the east <WH6924>: and there he built <WH1129> an altar <WH4196> to the Lord <WH3068>, and called <WH7121> upon the name <WH8034> of the Lord <WH3068>.
And Abram <WH87> journeyed <WH5265>, going on <WH1980> still <WH5265> toward the south <WH5045>.
And there was a famine <WH7458> in the land <WH776>: and Abram <WH87> went down <WH3381> into Egypt <WH4714> to stay <WH1481> there <WH7458>; for the famine was severe <WH3515> in the land <WH776>.

And it came to pass <WH834>, when he was come near <WH7126> to enter <WH935> into Egypt <WH4714>, that he said <WH559> to Sarai <WH8297> his wife <WH802>, Behold <WH2009> now <WH4994>, I know <WH3045> that you are a fair <WH3303> woman <WH802> to look upon <WH4758>:

Therefore it shall come to pass <WH4713>, when the Egyptians shall see <WH7200> you <WH559>, that they shall say, This is his wife <WH802>: and they will kill <WH2026> me <WH2421>, but they will save you alive.
Say <WH559>, I pray you <WH4994>, you are my sister <WH269>: that <WH4616> it may be well <WH3190> with me for your sake <WH5315>; and my soul shall live <WH2421> because of you <WH1558>.
And it came to pass <WH87>, that, when Abram was come <WH935> into Egypt <WH4714>, the Egyptians <WH4713> looked <WH7200> the woman <WH802> that she was very <WH3966> fair <WH3303>.

The princes <WH8269> also of Pharaoh <WH6547> saw <WH7200> her <WH1984>, and praised her before <WH413> Pharaoh <WH6547>: and the woman <WH802> was taken <WH3947> into Pharaoh <WH6547>'s house <WH1004>.

And he dealt <WH3190> Abram <WH87> well <WH3190> for her sake <WH6629>: and he had sheep, and oxen <WH1241>, and male donkeys <WH2543>, and male servants <WH5650>, and female servants <WH8198>, and female donkeys <WH860>, and camels <WH1581>.
And the Lord <WH3068> plagued <WH5060> Pharaoh <WH6547> and his house <WH1004> with great <WH1419> plagues <WH5061> because of <WH1697> Sarai <WH8297> Abram <WH87>'s wife <WH802>.
And Pharaoh <WH6547> called <WH7121> Abram <WH87>, and said <WH559>, What is this that you have done <WH6213> to me <WH5046>? Why didn't you tell me that she was your wife <WH802>?
Why did you say <WH559>, She is my sister <WH269>? So I might have taken <WH3947> her to me to wife <WH802>: now therefore behold your wife <WH802>, take <WH3947> her <WH3212>, and go your way.
And Pharaoh <WH6547> commanded <WH6680> his men <WH582> concerning him <WH7971>: and they sent him away, and his wife <WH802>, and all that he had.
